solution.text:
We know that Rohan can travel _{j}_ km with _{k}_ litres of petrol.
Therefore, with 1L of petrol, he can drive: \( _{j}_ \div _{k}_ = _{{Fraction(j,k)}}_ km\)
Thus, with _{l}_ litres of petrol, he can drive \(_{{Fraction(j,k)}}_ \times _{l}_ = _{{Fraction(j*l,k)}}_ km\)

content.text: Rohan’s car can be driven _{j}_ km with _{k}_ litres of petrol. How far can it be driven with _{l}_ litres of petrol?
